FuncDef: The reset isis statistics command deletes IS-IS packet or socket statistics.
CLIs: reset isis statistics { packet | socket } [ interface [ <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> ] ]
reset isis statistics packet lsp [ <process-id> | { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> } ]

ParaDef.Info:
Deletes IS-IS packet statistics on a specified interface.
-

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
If the parameter is not specified, IS-IS packet statistics on all interfaces are deleted.
-

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
If the parameter is not specified, IS-IS packet statistics on all interfaces are deleted.
-

Deletes IS-IS packet statistics of the specified IS-IS process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Deletes statistics about LSPs of specified VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When troubleshooting IS-IS network faults, you can run the reset isis statistics command to delete the existing statistics before checking new information about incorrect LSPs and Hello packets.
